bayou.http

Class HttpProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.http.HttpProxy

  • public class HttpProxy
extends Object
    Proxy information for HttpClient. See HttpClientConf.proxy(HttpProxy).

    This class is a simple data structure for proxy address and authentication.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpProxy(TcpAddress address, Supplier<Async<UserPass>> userPassSupplier)
      Create an HttpProxy.
      HttpProxy(String host, int port, String username, String password)
      Create an HttpProxy.
      HttpProxy(String host, int port)
      Create an HttpProxy.

    • Method Summary

      Instance Methods
      TcpAddress address()
      The proxy address.
      Supplier<Async<UserPass>> userPassSupplier()
      The username/password supplier for proxy authentication.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpProxy

        public HttpProxy(TcpAddress address,
                 Supplier<Async<UserPass>> userPassSupplier)
        Create an HttpProxy.

        If userPassSupplier!=null, Basic/Digest authentications are supported by HttpClient for proxy authentication.

      • HttpProxy

        public HttpProxy(String host,
                 int port,
                 String username,
                 String password)
        Create an HttpProxy.

        This is a convenience method for HttpProxy(address, userPassSupplier) with address.ssl=false.

      • HttpProxy

        public HttpProxy(String host,
                 int port)
        Create an HttpProxy.

        This is a convenience method for HttpProxy(address, userPassSupplier) with address.ssl=false, userPassSupplier=null.

    • Method Detail

      • address

        public TcpAddress address()
        The proxy address.

      • userPassSupplier

        public Supplier<Async<UserPass>> userPassSupplier()
        The username/password supplier for proxy authentication.
